isis.stitle: DT/DTA-466 Diesel Engine Service (1990) - LUBRICATING OIL PUMP, OIL FILTERS AND COOLER - OIL COOLER AND COOLANT FILTER HEADER ASSEMBLY

svcsubsec.title: OIL COOLER AND COOLANT FILTER HEADER ASSEMBLY

note.para: EFFECTIVE WITH S/N 517251 ENGINES EQUIPPED WITH A COOLANT FILTER HAVE THE COOLANT FILTER HEADER INTEGRAL WITH THE OIL COOLER. SERVICE OF THE OIL COOLER OR COOLANT FILTER WILL REMAIN THE SAME EXCEPT WHERE NOTED. FOR INDIVIDUAL COMPONENT PARTS (FIGURE 9.4).

svcproc.title: REMOVAL
svcproc.para: Remove the oil cooler as follows:

note.para: Engine cooling system must be drained.

step1.para: Prior to oil cooler removal, the cooler itself must be drained of oil and coolant.

step2.para:
Drain the oil from the oil cooler. Refer to Figure 9.30
.

Drain the coolant from the oil cooler. Refer to Figure 9.31
.
Reinstall and tighten oil and coolant drain plugs after draining the oil cooler.
If applied, turn the coolant filter shut-off valve to the "OFF" position, remove the "spin-on" filter and discard.

figure.caption: Figure 9.30. Drain Oil from the Oil Cooler.
Figure 9.31. Drain Coolant from Oil Cooler.

step1.para:
Loosen and remove the four "patch" bolts and washers which secure the oil cooler and coolant filter to the crankcase. Refer to Figure 9.32
.

note.para: Support the oil cooler when mounting bolts are removed.

THE CURRENT COOLANT FILTER HEADER IS EQUIPPED WITH A SHUT-OFF VALVE WHICH IS ACTIVATED BY A SHUT-OFF LEVER (FIGURE 9.32). WHEN THE MANUALLY OPERATED SHUT-OFF LEVER IS IN THE VERTICAL POSITION, THE VALVE IS OPEN AND THE COOLANT FILTER IS OPERATIONAL. WHEN THE LEVER IS IN THE HORIZONTAL POSITION THE VALVE IS CLOSED AND THE COOLANT FILTER IS BY-PASSED. BE SURE THE LEVER IS IN THE VERTICAL POSITION DURING ENGINE OPERATION.
EARLY STYLE COOLANT FILTER ARRANGEMENTS HAD SHUT-OFF VALVES LOCATED ON TUBES LEADING TO AND FROM FILTER HEADER.

step1.para: Remove the oil cooler or oil cooler and coolant filter header assembly from the crankcase. Discard the oil cooler gaskets.

note.para: It will be necessary to move the oil cooler or oil cooler and coolant filter header assembly rearward to free it from the front cover. Refer to Figure 9.33. Discard O-Rings at front cover.

figure.caption: Figure 9.32. Remove Oil Cooler Mounting Bolts.

step1.para: If applied, remove the coolant filter header from the oil cooler as follows:

step2.para:
Remove the two oil cooler/coolant filter header to front cover tubes and O-Rings from the coolant filter header. Discard the O-Rings. Refer to Figure 9.4
.

Loosen and remove the three coolant filter header to oil cooler mounting bolts and hardened washers. Refer to Figure 9.34
. Discard the large and small seal rings at the oil cooler. Refer to Figure 9.4
.
